meanings.definition: Extending far down from the top or surface.
meanings.sent1: The well was the deepest in the village.
meanings.sent2: The mine shaft reached the deepest point underground.
meanings.sent3: The cat dug its deepest hole yet in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as deep as the deepest ocean.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree went down to the deepest depths of the soil.

meanings.sent2: The storm brought the deepest snowfall of the year.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke hit the deepest nerve in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The pain in her heart was the deepest she had ever felt.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset were the deepest shades of red and orange.

meanings.sent1: The book had the deepest impact on her life.
meanings.sent2: His words had the deepest meaning to her.
meanings.sent3: The mystery of the missing sock was the deepest concern of the day.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was the deepest connection she had ever experienced.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the deepest emotions of the human soul.
